Core Pipeline Classes¶

Process¶

class batchq.core.process.BaseProcess(command=None, args=[], environment=None, terminal_preferred=True, terminal_required=False, check_timeout=0.050000000000000003)[source]¶
buffer[source]¶

This property holds the buffer of the session, i.e. a log over all output from the terminal.

can_read()[source]¶

Checks wether we can read from the output stream.

can_write()[source]¶

Checks wether it is possible to write to the input stream.

flush()[source]¶

Flushes the standard input.

getchar()[source]¶

Returns the next char

has_terminal[source]¶
isalive()[source]¶

Checks whether the process is alive or not.

kill()[source]¶

Kills the process.

pid[source]¶

Holds the PID of the process.

read()[source]¶

Reads as many chars as possible.

spawn(command, args=[], environment=None)[source]¶

This functions spawns command with arguments args. Note that command must be absolute or in the current directory. Commands in the system PATH will fail. To include this commands use the which function found in utils.

spawnTTY(command, args=[], environment=None)[source]¶

This is a placeholder for spawning a TTY. It should be overridden for the different OS’.

terminate()[source]¶

Terminates the process.

write(str)[source]¶

This function writes str to the pipe.

class batchq.core.communication.BasePipe(pipe, expect_token, submit_token, mem_scale=1000.0, vt100=None, initiate_pipe=True)[source]¶
buffer[source]¶

Contains the VT100 interpreted buffer.

child_memory_usage[source]¶
consume_output(pipe=None, consume_until=None)[source]¶

This function consumes output of the pipe which is separated with no more than 10 ms and returns it.

cpu_usage()[source]¶
expect(val=None)[source]¶
initiate_pipe()[source]¶

This function is a virtual function which is called at the end if the objects initiation. Its purpose is to initiate the pipe with a series of commands.

send_command(cmd)[source]¶

This function sends a command to the pipe, wait for the prompt to appear and return the output.

This property holds an instance of a XTermInterpreter.
